aims to detect: type and boundaries of the entities
baseline model.from sentence: The baseline model, described in detail in Bekoulis et al. (2018b), is illustrated in Fig. 1. It aims to detect (i) the type and the boundaries of the entities and (ii) the relations between them.
The input is a sequence of tokens (i.e., sentence) w = w1, ....,wn.

use.from sentence: We use character level embeddings to implicitly capture morphological features (e.g., prefixes and suffixes), representing each character by a vector (embedding).
We also use pre-trained word embeddings.

baseline model.from sentence: For the NER task, we adopt the BIO (Beginning, Inside, Outside) encoding scheme.
We model the relation extraction task as a multi-label head selection problem (Bekoulis et al., 2018b; Zhang et al., 2017).

Adversarial training (AT).from sentence: We exploit the idea of AT (Goodfellow et al., 2015) as a regularization method to make our model robust to input perturbations.
